remarks: The reverse implication of ~ islindeps2 does not hold for arbitrary (left) modules, see note in [Roman] p. 112:  "... if a nontrivial linear combination of the elements ... in an R-module M is 0, ... where not all of the coefficients are 0, then we cannot conclude ... that one of the elements ... is a linear combination of the others."  This means that there is at least one left module having a linearly dependent subset in which there is at least one element which is not a linear combinantion of the other elements of this subset.  Such a left module can be constructed by using ~ zlmodzxzequa and ~ zlmodzxznm (Contributed by AV, 25-May-2019.)  (Revised by AV, 30-Jul-2019.)
